data.title: MTV celebrates its 30th anniversary on VH1 Classic this weekend
authors: Special To The Orange County Register
data.meta_description: MTV launched the music video revolution on Aug. 1, 1981, and so we’d be remiss to let its 30th birthday pass without looking back at the past three decades of music, videos, reality TV and more. You’ll find 30 memorable images in the slide show above — just click on that classic shot of the […]
data.text:
MTV launched the music video revolution on Aug. 1, 1981, and so we’d be remiss to let its 30th birthday pass without looking back at the past three decades of music, videos, reality TV and more. You’ll find 30 memorable images in the slide show above — just click on that classic shot of the original VJs to get started — and once you’ve taken a spin through it come back here and let us know your favorite MTV memories.

You can also spend the weekend on sister channel VH1 Classic, which will air a three-day tribute called “MTV30 on VH1 Classic,” which will include at midnight on Sunday a replay of the first-ever hour of original programming on MTV. (You may well know that the first video played was the Buggles’ “Video Killed The Radio Star,” but can you tell us what else played that first hour without looking? The answer is at the end of the slide show above.)

The VH1 weekend also will include clips from shows such as “Remote Control,” “YO! MTV Raps,” Beavis and Butt-Head,” “Headbangers Ball,” “The Real World,” “Liquid TV” and “Club MTV.” They’ll also show highlights from the MTV Movie Awards, the Video Music Awards, Live Aid and more.

You want your MTV? You get those original promos and a whole lot more this weekend.

PREVIOUSLY FROM PEDRO
